sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lockheed Martins Board of Directors is dedicated to representing the interests of our stockholders, overseeing management, and ensuring leaders are accountable for their actions and decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is proud of our strong performance and commitment to the highest standards of corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARILLYN A. HEWSON
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 17, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please join me and the other members of the Lockheed Martin Board of Directors for the Annual Meeting of Stockholders on Thursday, April 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year was an extraordinary year of transition at Lockheed Martin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below, I have highlighted some of the achievements related to our operations and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategically Reshaped Our Portfolio
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued our strategic plan to reshape our portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accomplished this by largely completing the integration of Sikorsky Aircraft, which we acquired in November 2015, and then realigning Mission Systems and Training into a new business area named Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RMS now has broader capabilities  from military and civil helicopters to naval ships and combat systems to radar and sonar sensors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also divested Lockheed Martin Information Systems & Global Solutions (IS&GS), our government information technology and services business, in a tax-efficient manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current business portfolio is firmly focused on blending our complex platforms for optimal results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivered Strong Financial Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual sales of $47.2 billion were up 17 percent from 2015 and set a new record for the Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We increased earnings per share and generated 18 percent total stockholder return, including $2 billion in dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 marked the 14th consecutive year that the dividend rate has been increased by a double-digit percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We repurchased 8.9 million shares for $2.1 billion during the year and retired 9.4 million outstanding shares of our stock in connection with our divestiture of IS&GS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhanced Our Governance Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We proactively adopted proxy access and expanded the technical expertise of our Board of Directors by electing Ilene S. Gordon in June 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer of Ingredion Incorporated, Ms. Gordon is experienced with the demands and challenges of the global marketplace and brings to the boardroom an in-depth understanding of industrial manufacturing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Always attentive to the critical need to refresh the Board and plan for the succession of our members, the Board has elected four new Directors in the past five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are counting on your vote and encourage you to cast it promptly  even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thank you for your continued support of Lockheed Martin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Marillyn A. Hewson Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Pay and Performance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A substantial portion of compensation paid to our named executive officers (NEOs) is performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use the 50th percentile of our comparator group to set target compensation but our plans provide for payments to exceed or fall below the target levels based upon actual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of our strong short- and long-term performance track record, our annual and long-term incentive plans paid out above the targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This outcome is consistent with our pay for performance philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Boards Responsiveness to 2016 Stockholder Advisory Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 annual meeting, more than 40 percent of the votes cast by stockholders were in favor of an advisory, non-binding stockholder proposal to reduce the Corporations special meeting stock ownership threshold to 15 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Bylaws, any stockholder who individually owns 10 percent, or stockholders who in the aggregate own 25 percent, of the outstanding common stock may request the calling of a special meeting to consider any business properly brought before the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommended a vote against the stockholder proposal because it believes stockholders already have a meaningful right to call special meetings (see Stockholder Right to Call Special Meeting on page 15).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the stockholder proposal received less than the required majority of the votes cast and did not prevail, the Board evaluated the voting results carefully and considered investor feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other things the Board considered:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: its current governance practices, including the annual election of directors and the proactive adoption of proxy access;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: other avenues available to stockholders to influence the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the composition of our stockholder base and changes that might result in different vote outcomes from year to year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: feedback from long-term, institutional investors that are comfortable with the current provision; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our long-standing investor engagement program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking these items into account, the Board concluded that the current special meeting provision strikes an appropriate balance between stockholder access to the Board and the interests of the Corporation and its stockholders in promoting the appropriate use of company resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will continue to seek investor input on special meeting requirements and monitor developments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Summary

sentences.text: Long-Standing, Active Investor Engagement Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize the value of listening and taking into account the views of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More than 94 percent of the votes cast at our 2016 Annual Meeting approved our Say-on-Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuous and transparent communication with our investors helps senior management gain useful feedback on a wide range of opics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investor views are communicated to the Board of Directors and are instrumental in the development of our policies and informs our business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we had 34 engagements by telephone conference and/or written correspondence with our largest institutional investors and other significant stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engaged with investors about an array of issues, including proxy access, stockholders right to call special meetings, Board composition and the Boards role in strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We learned that many investors considered proxy access an important tool but one that should only be used in unique circumstances to enhance long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this feedback, the Board proactively adopted proxy access in September 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe hat it complements our existing suite of stockholder rights and further strengthens our governance standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response to updated proxy voting guidelines issued by proxy advisory firms in late 2016 that are effective for 2017 annual meetings, we sought the views of our institutional investors on policy changes that impact the Corporations governance practices, including the restrictions in the Corporations Bylaws on the ability of stockholders to amend the Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As permitted by long-standing provisions of Maryland law, since the creation of the Corporation in 1995, the right to adopt or amend bylaws has been vested exclusively with the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In exercising that authority, our directors have a duty to act in the best interests of the Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many investors had policies in place that differed from the proxy advisory firms newly adopted policies or were just beginning their evaluation of the changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board views significant changes to governance as warranting deliberate and thorough review of the purpose and consequences of proposed changes and a comprehensive assessment of investor input.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to ensure this level of review, we will continue our dialogue with investors so that the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee (Governance Committee) can properly consider at its meetings during 2017 whether changes to our Bylaws are appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lockheed Martin believes good governance is integral to achieving long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors primary role is to oversee management and represent the interests of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are expected to attend Board meetings, the meetings of the committees on which they serve and the annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the committees regularly schedule and hold executive sessions without any members of management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Between meetings, directors interact with the Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO), the Lead Director and other members of management and are available to provide advice and counsel to management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines (Governance Guidelines) that describe the framework within which the Board and its committees oversee  the  governance  of  the  Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  current  Governance  Guidelines  are  available  on  the  Corporations  website  at www.lockheedmartin.com/corporate-governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee regularly assesses our governance practices in light of emerging trends and best practices and formally implements best governance practices that it believes enhance the operation and effectiveness of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Guidelines cover a wide range of subjects, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the role of the Board and director responsibilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the role and responsibilities of the Lead Director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: application of our Code of Ethics and Business Conduct (the Code of Conduct) to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director nomination procedures and qualifications;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director independence standards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: policies for the review, approval and ratification of related person transactions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director orientation and continuing education;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review by the Governance Committee of any change in job responsibilities of an incumbent director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: procedures for annual performance evaluations of the Board and its committees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director stock ownership guidelines (currently, an amount equal to five times the cash portion of the annual retainer);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a clawback policy for executive incentive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: anti-hedging and anti-pledging transactions involving our stock; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: majority voting for the election of directors and resignation procedures for directors who fail to receive a majority vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Role in Strategic Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is involved in strategic planning and review throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board met in the fall in a session dedicated to a discussion of the Corporations and each Business Segments strategic plan for 2017, and preliminary long range plan and financial strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board convened a second session later in the fall to review the Corporations technology strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The completed long range plan was then reviewed with the Board in January 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This schedule corresponds to managements annual planning schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Strategic Affairs Committee of the Board reviews the progress and challenges to the Corporations strategy and approves specific initiatives, including acquisitions and divestitures over a certain monetary threshold;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Chairman, President and CEO reviews developments within the context of the Corporations strategic framework regularly at Board meetings; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Board (or the appropriate Committee) reviews trends identified as significant risks and topical items of strategic interest such as human capital strategy and cybersecurity on a regular basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our Bylaws and Governance Guidelines, the independent members of the Board annually elect one of the independent directors to serve as the Lead Director by the affirmative vote of a majority of the directors who have been determined to be independent for purposes of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has structured the role of the Lead Director with sufficient authority to serve as a counter-balance to management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The responsibilities specified in our Bylaws for the Lead Director are to:

sentences.text: The Board regularly reviews its leadership structure in light of the Corporations current needs, governance trends, internal assessments of Board effectiveness and other factors.

sentences.text: The Board reviews and considers whether the positions of Chairman and CEO should be combined or separated as part of an ongoing review of the effectiveness of the Corporations governance structure.

sentences.text: The Board believes that it must be independent and must provide strong and effective oversight, but also believes that the independent Board members should have the flexibility to respond to changing circumstances and choose the model that best fits the current situation.

sentences.text: As a result, the roles of Chairman and CEO have been split from time to time to facilitate leadership transitions, while at other times the roles have been combined.

sentences.text: The Board believes that, at the present time, the Corporation is best served by allocating governance responsibilities between a combined Chairman and CEO and an independent Lead Director with robust responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Effectiveness and Refreshment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board composition is one of the most critical areas of focus for the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having the right mix of people who bring diverse perspectives, business and professional experiences and skills, provides a foundation for robust dialogue, informed advice and collaboration in the boardroom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider current board skills, composition, tenure and anticipated retirements to define gaps that may need to be filled through the board refreshment process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Detailed understanding of the Corporations business takes time, and tenure limitations may prevent the Board from taking advantage of insight that long tenure brings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board strives to ensure an environment that encourages diverse critical thinking and values innovative, strategic discussions to achieve a higher level of success for the Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee screens and recommends candidates for nomination by the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has been assisted from time to time with its recruitment efforts by an outside search firm, which recommends candidates that satisfy the criteria defined by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The search firm provides background research and pertinent information regarding prospective candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the 2016 annual meeting, the Board has elected Ilene S. Gordon to the Board (see Ms. Gordons biography on page 27).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Gordon was initially identified by our search firm because she satisfied the Boards criteria.

sentences.text: Ms. Gordon brings to the boardroom a unique and in-depth perspective on the role of technology and the importance of innovation in manufacturing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To enhance Board functioning and the effectiveness of the Boards relationship with management for the benefit of our stockholders, the Board regularly evaluates its performance through self-assessments, corporate governance reviews and periodic charter reviews.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those evaluations, changes in our business strategy or operating environment and the future needs of the Board in light of anticipated director retirements are used to identify desired backgrounds and skill sets for future Board members.

sentences.text: The self-assessment helps the Governance Committee to track progress in certain areas targeted for improvement from year-to-year and to identify ways to enhance the Boards and committees effectiveness.

sentences.text: Director Overboarding Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recognizes that its members benefit from service on the boards of other companies and it encourages such service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also believes, however, that it is critical that directors dedicate sufficient time to their service on the Corporations Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Governance Guidelines provide that, without obtaining the approval of the Governance Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director may not serve on the boards of more than four other public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the director is an active chief executive officer or equivalent of another public company, the director may not serve on the boards of more than two other public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this purpose, the Board considers a public company to be a company subject to the U.S. rules on public company governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use this definition because it is consistent with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) requirement for disclosure of board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For companies organized outside of the U.S., the Board considers the time commitment of the particular board and other relevant factors to determine if these should be taken into account in an overboarding assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of the Audit Committee may serve on more than two other public company audit committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of the Compensation Committee may serve on more than three other public company compensation committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors must notify the CEO, Lead Director and Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary before accepting an invitation to serve on the board of any other public company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee reviews and determines whether the position would affect the directors ability to serve on the Corporations Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, all Lockheed Martin directors attended more than 75 percent of the total Board and committee meetings on which they served.

sentences.text: Majority Voting Policy for Director Elections
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporations Charter and Bylaws provide for simple majority voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Governance Guidelines, in any uncontested election of directors, any incumbent director who receives more votes AGAINST than votes FOR is required to offer his or her resignation for Board consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon receipt of a resignation of a director tendered as a result of a failed stockholder vote, the Governance Committee will make a recommendation to the Board as to whether to accept or reject the resignation, or whether other action is recommended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering the tendered resignation, the Board will consider the Governance Committees recommendation as well as any other factors it deems relevant, which may include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the qualifications of the director whose resignation has been tendered;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the directors past and expected future contributions to the Corporation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the overall composition of the Board and its committees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether accepting the tendered resignation would cause the Corporation to fail to meet any applicable rule or regulation (including NYSE listing standards and the federal securities laws); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the percentage of outstanding shares represented by the votes cast at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will act on a tendered resignation within 90 days following certification of the stockholder vote for the annual meeting and will promptly disclose its decision and rationale as to whether to accept the resignation (or the reasons for rejecting the resignation, if applicable) in a press release, in a filing with the SEC, or by other public announcement, including a posting on the Corporations website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a directors resignation is accepted by the Board, or if a nominee for director who is not an incumbent director is not elected, the Board may fill the resulting vacancy or may decrease the size of the Board pursuant to the Corporations Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may not fill any vacancy so created with a director who was nominated but not elected at the annual meeting by the vote required under the Corporations Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has established semi-annual talent reviews that coincide with our business operating reviews, as well as quarterly reviews within each of our operating businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During these reviews, the executive leadership team discusses succession plans for key positions, including the CEO, and identifies top talent for development in future leadership roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to long-term succession planning, we have a contingency plan if the CEO were to depart unexpectedly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also is actively engaged in talent management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, the Board meets to review our succession strategy and leadership pipeline for key roles, including the CEO, taking into account the Corporations long-term corporate strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: High potential leaders are given exposure and visibility to Board members through formal presentations and informal events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More broadly, the Board is regularly updated on key talent indicators for the overall workforce, including diversity, recruiting and development programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board members also are active partners, engaging and spending time with our high potential leaders throughout the year at Board meetings and other events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Role in Enterprise Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our risk management philosophy is to balance risk and reward within management and the Boards risk tolerance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is accomplished through risk management practices, core values and our Code of Conduct, each of which reinforces a risk transparent culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its committees receive risk updates throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive management provides updates on risks managed at the Enterprise level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Business Segment management provides updates on risks to its respective objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board considers the full spectrum of business risks, including strategic, operational, financial, reputation and compliance risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversight of risk is assigned to the full Board unless delegated to one of the standing committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews our policies and practices with respect to risk assessment and risk management, identification and oversight of the Corporations major financial risk exposures and the steps that have been taken to monitor and control such exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reports the results of its review to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards committees review risks within their respective domains.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk mitigation for the risks identified as most significant to our corporate objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and strategy are reviewed by the Strategic Affairs Committee or the full Board.

sentences.text: Stockholder Right to Call Special Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stockholder who individually owns 10 percent, or stockholders who in the aggregate own 25 percent, of the outstanding common stock may demand the calling of a special meeting to consider any business properly brought before the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws do not restrict the timing of a request for a special meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The only subject matter restriction is that we are not required to call a special meeting to consider a matter that is substantially the same as a matter voted on at a special meeting within the preceding 12 months unless requested by a majority of all stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that our current governance practice strikes an appropriate balance between the right of stockholders to call a special meeting and the interests of the Corporation and its stockholders in promoting the appropriate use of company resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 25 percent threshold is the most prevalent standard among the companies in our comparator group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board added the 10 percent threshold in light of our institutional ownership profile which has included large holdings by a single investor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will continue to review and evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of the current stock ownership thresholds relative to changes in our investor profile from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Poison Pill
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporation does not have a Stockholder Rights Plan, otherwise known as a Poison Pill.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through our Governance Guidelines, the Board has communicated that it has no intention of adopting one at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has indicated that, if it were to adopt a Stockholder Rights Plan, the Board would seek stockholder ratification within 12 months of the date of adoption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eleven of our current directors are independent under applicable NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the NYSE listing standards and our Governance Guidelines, a director is not independent if the director has a direct or indirect material relationship with the Corporation.

sentences.text: The Governance Committee annually reviews the independence of all directors and reports its findings to the full Board.

sentences.text: To assist in this review, the Board has adopted director independence guidelines that are included in our Governance Guidelines, which are available on our Corporations website at www.lockheedmartin.com/corporate-governance.

sentences.text: Related Person Transaction Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has approved a written policy and procedures for the review, approval and ratification of transactions among the Corporation and its directors, executive officers and their related interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the policy is available on the Corporations website at www.lockheedmartin.com/corporate- governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, all related person transactions (as defined in the policy) are to be reviewed by the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee may approve or ratify related person transactions at its discretion if deemed fair and reasonable to the Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This may include situations where the Corporation provides products or services to related persons on an arms length basis on terms comparable to those provided to unrelated third parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any director who participates in or is the subject of an existing or potential related person transaction may not participate in the decision-making process of the Governance Committee with respect to that transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, and consistent with applicable SEC regulations and NYSE listing standards, a related person transaction is any transaction in which the Corporation was, is or will be a participant, where the amount involved exceeds $120,000, and in which a related person had, has, or will have a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A related person includes any director or director-nominee, any executive officer of the Corporation, any person who is known to be the beneficial owner of more than five percent of any class of the Corporations voting securities, or an immediate family member of any person described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our policy requires each director and executive officer to complete an annual questionnaire to identify his or her related interests and persons, and to notify the Corporation of changes in that information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on that information, the Corporation maintains a master list of related persons for purposes of tracking and reporting related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because it may not be possible or practical to pre-approve all related person transactions, the policy contemplates that the Governance Committee may ratify transactions after they commence or pre-approve categories of transactions or relationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Governance Committee declines to approve or ratify a transaction, the related person transaction is referred to management to make a recommendation to the Governance Committee concerning whether the transaction should be terminated or amended in a manner that is acceptable to the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strive to enhance continually our high standards and controls for ethical business conduct, compliance and transparency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our values  Do Whats Right, Respect Others and Perform with Excellence  underpin our comprehensive Code of Conduct and Supplier Code of Conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct, which has been in place since the Corporation was formed in 1995 (available on the Corporations website at www.lockheedmartin.com/us/who-we- are/ethics/code.html), applies to all Lockheed Martin employees, Board members, consultants, contract laborers and other agents when they represent or act on behalf of the Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It summarizes our policies and expectations for a number of topics, including our commitment to good citizenship, promoting a positive and safe work environment, providing transparency in our public disclosures, zero tolerance for corruption, avoiding conflicts of interest, honoring the confidentiality of sensitive information, preservation and use of company assets, compliance with all laws, preventing retaliation against reporting parties and operating with integrity in all that we do.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To support implementation of this Code of Conduct, Board members, officers and employees participate annually in ethics awareness training.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no waivers from any provisions of our Code of Conduct applicable to any Board member or executive officer in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: introduced a mobile application of our Gifts Decision Tree Tool so employees can check on-the-go whether they are able to give or accept a gift or business courtesy;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: expanded the resources offered globally to suppliers through our Ethics Supplier Mentoring Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Suppliers can now utilize a Self-Assessment Tool that includes non-U.S. standards for an effective ethics and anti-corruption program, watch short videos on the elements of an effective ethics program or participate in live webinars to discuss these topics with their peers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: earned 11 awards for Ethics training and communications videos, including Ethics Awareness Training, Business Conduct Compliance Training and our Integrity Minute series.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our sustainability mission is to foster innovation, integrity and security to protect the environment, strengthen communities and foster responsible growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our sustainability strategy guides a systematic approach to understand and manage environmental, social and governance risks that represent stakeholder priorities and drivers of long-term business success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Lockheed Martin:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: published its fifth annual sustainability report, which discloses performance indicators on our environmental, social and governance commitments and responsibilities and adheres to the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) G4 Core Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our sustainability reports are available at www.lockheedmartin.com/sustainability; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: set new goals for our Sustainability Management Plan in the priority issue areas of business integrity, product impact, employee wellbeing, resource efficiency and information security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed mid- and full-year performance of these commitments with our executive leadership team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process is intended to strengthen business opportunities and enterprise risk management mechanisms, drive energy and natural resource efficiency, and maximize our investments of financial, human and natural capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: named to the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index, which included Lockheed Martin for the third consecutive year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: selected as only U.S. aerospace and defense company to receive Gold Class distinction from RobecoSAM for excellence in sustainability performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: earned an A rating from MSCI for environmental, social and governance management and performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: named to the Climate A List by CDP for climate change mitigation including disclosure, awareness, management and leadership actions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: increased two spots to rank eighth among the 100 Best Corporate Citizens by Corporate Responsibility (CR) Magazine;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: earned a U.S. Chamber of Commerce Foundation Citizens Award for Best Commitment to Education in recognition of the Corporations support for programs that provide students with opportunities to foster curiosity and sustained interest in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) education; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recognized by the Sustainable Purchasing Leadership Council with two Leadership Awards for Supplier Engagement for enabling broader marketplace transformation through collaboration, and two Outstanding Case Study Awards.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for assisting the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities relating to the financial condition of the Corporation, the integrity of the Corporations financial statements and the Corporations compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee has oversight of the Corporations internal audit organization, including enterprise risk management processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention, oversight and termination of the Corporations independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also is responsible for reviewing the allocation of resources, the Corporations financial condition and capital structure and policies regarding derivatives and capital expenditures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee meets privately with the Senior Vice President, Internal Audit and Ethics and Sustainability, and the Corporations independent auditors, Ernst & Young LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The functions of the Audit Committee are further described under the heading Audit Committee Report on page 31.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All the members of the Audit Committee are independent within the meaning of the NYSE listing standards, applicable SEC regulations and our Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Classified Business and Security Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Classified Business and Security Committee (the CBS Committee) assists the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities relating to the Corporations classified business activities and the security of personnel, facilities and data (including classified cybersecurity matters, as applicable).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CBS Committee consists of three or more directors who meet the independence requirements of the NYSE listing standards and who possess the appropriate security clearance credentials, at least one of whom must be a member of the Audit Committee, and none of whom are officers or employees of the Corporation and are free from any relationship that, in the opinion of the Board, would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment as a member of the CBS Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the CBS Committee hold high-level security clearances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ethics and Sustainability Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Ethics and Sustainability Committee is to assist the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities relating to the Corporations ethical conduct, sustainability, environmental stewardship and employee safety and health.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Ethics and Sustainability Committee monitors compliance and recommends changes to our Code of Conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It reviews our policies, procedures and compliance with respect to sustainability, including corporate responsibility, human rights, environmental stewardship, employee safety and health, ethical business practices, community outreach, philanthropy, diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It oversees matters pertaining to community and public relations, including government relations, political contributions and expenditures and charitable contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Ethics and Sustainability Committee meets privately with the Senior Vice President, Internal Audit and Ethics and Sustainability, and the Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committee serves primarily as a means for taking action requiring Board approval between regularly scheduled meetings of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committee is authorized to act for the full Board on all matters other than those specifically reserved by Maryland law to the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board chairs the Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management Development and Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and approves the corporate goals and objectives relevant to the compensation of the CEO, evaluates the performance of the CEO and, either as a committee or together with the other independent members of the Board, determines and approves the compensation philosophy and levels for the CEO and other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information regarding the role of the Compensation Committee and our compensation practices and procedures is provided under the captions Compensation Committee Report on page 33, Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) beginning on page 33 and Other Corporate Governance Considerations in Compensation on page 48.

sentences.text: In January 2016 the Board of Directors established an ad hoc committee (the Transaction Committee) in connection with the divestiture of the Corporations IS&GS business to Leidos Holdings, Inc. through a tax-efficient Reverse Morris Trust transaction.

sentences.text: The Transaction Committee was comprised of independent directorsDaniel F. Akerson, Nolan D. Archibald (Committee Chairman), James O. Ellis, Jr. and Thomas J. Falk.

sentences.text: The Committee members received no additional compensation for service on this Committee.

sentences.text: Board Composition, Qualifications and Diversity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have no agreements obligating the Corporation to nominate a particular candidate as a director, and none of our directors represents a special interest or a particular stockholder or group of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our business accomplishments are a result of the efforts of our employees around the world, and that a diverse employee population will result in a better understanding of our customers needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our success with a diverse workforce also informs our views about the value of a board of directors that has persons of diverse skills, experiences and backgrounds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To this end, the Board seeks to identify candidates with areas of knowledge or experience that will expand or complement the Boards existing expertise in overseeing a technologically advanced global security and aerospace company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity in skills and backgrounds ensures that the widest range of options and viewpoints are expressed in the boardroom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the Governance Guidelines, the Board desires a diverse group of candidates who possess the background, skills, expertise and time to make a significant contribution to the Board, the Corporation and its stockholders.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2: RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT AUDITORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointed Ernst & Young LLP (Ernst & Young), an independent registered public accounting firm, as the independent auditors to perform an integrated audit of the Corporations consolidated financial statements and internal control over financial reporting for the year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young served as our independent auditors in 2016 and 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The services provided to the Corporation by Ernst & Young for the last two fiscal years are described under the caption Fees Paid to Independent Auditors below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention, oversight and termination of the Corporations independent auditors in accordance with the NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also is responsible for the audit fee negotiations associated with the retention of Ernst & Young.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and its chairman are involved in the selection of Ernst & Youngs lead engagement partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee meets with Ernst & Young without management present at every meeting of the Audit Committee in which financial statements are reviewed and has met with Ernst & Youngs Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young has served as the Corporations independent registered public accounting firm since the Corporation was founded in 1995.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has discussed the advantages and disadvantages of external audit firm rotation and concluded that the continued retention of Ernst & Young to serve as the Corporations independent external auditors is in the best interest of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making that determination, the Audit Committee concluded that there was a correlation between Ernst & Youngs long tenure, institutional knowledge and expertise with respect to the Corporations business and government contracting practices, quality, and cost effective services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee considered that rotation to a new outside auditor would likely require a transition period for the new auditor to familiarize itself with the business and government contracting practices which would require increased attention by management as well as increased fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also considered the demands on management related to the Corporations recent strategic transactions and the value of Ernst & Youngs familiarity with the Corporation in a period of transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also considered Ernst & Youngs internal controls and independence practices as well as the periodic mandated rotation of the audit firms lead engagement partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews the engagement of Ernst & Young annually following completion of Ernst & Youngs audit of the prior years financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also conducts a mid-year assessment of the quality of Ernst & Youngs work.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its annual and mid-year assessment of Ernst & Young, the Audit Committee has considered:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the materials on independence provided by Ernst & Young;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: work quality;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: managements level of satisfaction with its services;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the adequacy of Ernst & Youngs staffing;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the breadth of knowledge, support and expertise of its national office and access to that expertise;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the length of time Ernst & Young has been engaged;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: external data regarding Ernst & Youngs audit quality and performance, including recent Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) reports on Ernst & Young and its peer firms;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: familiarity with the Corporations account;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: level of expertise in accounting issues relating to government contracts; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Youngs performance in providing independent analysis of management positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder approval of the appointment is not required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board believes that obtaining stockholder ratification of the appointment is a sound corporate governance practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the stockholders do not vote on an advisory basis in favor of Ernst & Young, the Audit Committee will reconsider whether to hire the firm and may retain Ernst & Young or hire another firm without resubmitting the matter for stockholders approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee retains the discretion at any time to appoint a different independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of Ernst & Young are expected to be present at the 2017 Annual Meeting, will be available to respond to appropriate questions and will have the opportunity to make a statement if they desire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends that you vote FOR the ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young as independent auditors for 2017 (Proposal 2).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-Approval of Independent Auditors Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee pre-approves all audit, audit-related, tax and other services performed by the independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee pre-approves specific categories of services up to pre-established fee thresholds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the type of service had previously been pre-approved, the Audit Committee must approve that specific service before the independent auditors may perform such service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, separate approval is required if the amount of fees for any pre-approved category of service exceeds the fee thresholds established by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also has delegated to the Committee Chairman or any member pre-approval authority with respect to permitted services, provided that the Committee Chairman or any member must report any pre-approval decisions to the Audit Committee at its next scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees Paid to Independent Auditors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table sets forth the fees billed by Ernst & Young, the Corporations independent auditors, for audit, audit-related services, tax services and all other services rendered for 2016 and 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All fees were pre-approved in accordance with the Audit Committees pre-approval policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee considered and concluded that the provision of these services by Ernst & Young was compatible with the maintenance of the auditors independence.The increase in fees from prior years is the result of audit and audit-related services provided in connection with:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the purchase accounting and internal controls review related to the acquisition of Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the divestiture of the IS&GS business; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: preparation for the new revenue recognition accounting standard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)  19,900,000  26,200,000 Audit-Related Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Audit fees for 2016 and 2015 are for services related to the annual audit of the Corporations consolidated financial statements, including the audit of internal control over financial reporting, the interim reviews of the Corporations quarterly financial statements, statutory audits of the Corporations foreign subsidiaries, consultations on accounting matters, and registration statements and other documents filed by the Corporation with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Audit-related fees for 2016 and 2015 are related to carve-out audits of a business units financial statements and audits of the Corporations employee benefit plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, audit-related fees for 2015 include amounts for due diligence services in connection with acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Tax fees for 2016 and 2015 are for domestic and international tax compliance and advisory services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, tax fees for 2016 and 2015 include amounts for due diligence services in connection with a divestiture and an acquisition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) All other fees for 2016 are primarily for subscriptions to Ernst & Youngs online research tools and training courses for professional qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other fees for 2015 are primarily for our Conflict Minerals Report and subscriptions to Ernst & Youngs online research tools.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of the Board of Directors is responsible for overseeing the Corporations accounting, auditing and financial reporting process, financial risk assessment and management process and for monitoring compliance with certain regulatory and compliance matters, on behalf of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporations management is responsible for preparing the quarterly and annual consolidated financial statements, the financial reporting process, and maintaining and evaluating disclosure controls and procedures and a system of internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to its oversight of the Corporations internal audit organization, the Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention, oversight and termination of the Corporations independent auditors, Ernst & Young, an independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ndependent auditors are responsible for performing an independent audit of the Corporations annual consolidated financial statements and internal controls over financial reporting and expressing an opinion on the conformity of those consolidated financial statements with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles and on the effectiveness of the Corporations internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the preparation of the Corporations financial statements as of and for the year ended December 31, 2016, the Audit Committee reviewed and discussed with management and Ernst & Young the Corporations audited consolidated financial statements, including discussions regarding critical accounting policies, financial accounting and reporting principles and practices, the quality of such principles and practices, the reasonableness of significant judgments and estimates, and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also discussed with Ernst & Young, with and without management, the quality of the financial statements, clarity of the related disclosures, effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting and other items required under Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) Auditing Standard No. 1301, Communications with Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Audit Committee received and reviewed the written disclosures and letter from Ernst & Young regarding its independence from the Corporation required by PCAOB Ethics and Independence Rule 3526, Communications with Audit Committees Concerning Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has also discussed with Ernst & Young any matters affecting its independence from the Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the Audit Committees reviews and discussions described in this report, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the audited consolidated financial statements as of and for the year ended December 31, 2016 be included in Lockheed Martin Corporations Annual Report on Form 10-K for 2016 for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also reappointed Ernst & Young to serve as the Corporations independent auditors for 2017, and requested that this appointment be submitted to the Corporations stockholders for ratification at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors approved the Audit Committees recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3: ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE THE COMPENSATION OF OUR NEOS (SAY-ON-PAY)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We ask our stockholders to vote annually to approve, on an advisory (non-binding) basis, the compensation of our named executive officers (NEOs) as described in detail in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) and the accompanying tables in the Executive Compensation section beginning on page 33.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is commonly known as Say-on-Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders should review the entire Proxy Statement and, in particular, the CD&A for information on our executive compensation programs and other important items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the information provided in this Proxy Statement demonstrates that our executive compensation programs are designed to link pay to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board recommends that stockholders approve the compensation of our NEOs by approving the following Say-on-Pay resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders of Lockheed Martin Corporation approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the named executive officers identified in the Summary Compensation Table, as disclosed in the Lockheed Martin Corporation 2017 Proxy Statement pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and the accompanying footnotes and narratives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is not intended to address any specific item of compensation, but rather our overall compensation policies and procedures related to the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the results of the Say-on-Pay vote do not bind the Corporation, the Board will, as it does each year, continue to review the results carefully and plans to continue to seek the views of our stockholders year-round.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends that you vote FOR the advisory vote to approve the compensation of our named executive officers (Proposal 3).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 4: ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF HOLDING VOTES ON SAY-ON-PAY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also are asking our stockholders to provide an advisory (non-binding) vote on how frequently stockholders should have an opportunity to vote on Say-on- Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Dodd-Frank Act, stockholders may vote to have the advisory vote on Say-on-Pay every one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are required to hold an advisory vote on the frequency of Say-on-Pay votes every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholders were provided with the opportunity to vote on the frequency of Say- on-Pay votes in 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stockholders voted in favor of holding Say-on-Pay votes annually and the Board adopted this standard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we believe we have an appropriately balanced executive compensation program, we recognize that the widely adopted standard is to hold Say-on- Pay votes annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also acknowledge current stockholder expectations and preferences regarding having the ability to express their views on the compensation of the companys named executive officers on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of investor expectations and prevailing market practice, we are asking stockholders to support the continuation of a frequency period of ONE YEAR (an annual vote) for future votes on Say-on-Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes on the frequency for Say-on-Pay are advisory.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although your vote on this Say-on-Pay resolution does not bind the Corporation, the Board of Directors will review the results of the vote and investor feedback and will continue to review the advantages and disadvantages for each of the frequencies on Say-on- Pay votes regardless of the outcome of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends that you vote FOR a frequency of ONE YEAR for future non-binding stockholder votes on the compensation of our named executive officers (Proposal 4).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary

sentences.text: Our 2016 Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Lockheed Martin achieved record levels of sales, cash flow from operations and earnings per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We successfully performed on our contracts while executing two portfolio-shaping initiatives that position the Corporation for long-term growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The integration of the Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation (Sikorsky) is largely completed with its realignment into our new Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS) Business Segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also completed the divestiture of our IS&GS Business Segment, in a tax-efficient Reverse Morris Trust transaction, which closed in the third quarter of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From a financial perspective, net sales for the year were $47.2 billion, compared to $40.5 billion in 2015, on a continuing operations basis (without IS&GS)  an increase of 17 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net earnings in 2016 were $3.8 billion, or $12.38 per share, compared to $3.1 billion, or $9.93 per share, in 2015, on a continuing operations basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash from Operations in 2016 was $5.2 billion, compared to $5.1 billion in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we also accomplished numerous strategic and operational milestones in addition to the Sikorsky integration and IS&GS divestiture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The U.S. Air Force declared Initial Operational Capability (IOC) for the F-35A, a significant achievement for the program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We received a $1.45 billion contract for production and delivery of Patriot Advanced Capability-3 (PAC-3) and PAC-3 Missile Segment Enhancement (PAC-3 MSE) interceptors for the U.S. Army and international allies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were selected by the Australian Government to be the Combat System Integrator on the Future Submarine Combat System program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We supported the successful launch of NASAs OSIRIS-REx spacecraft built by Lockheed Martin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also continued with the expansion of our international business during 2016, which represented 27% of our sales for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued our efforts to return cash to stockholders through dividends and share repurchases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we paid out $2 billion in dividends and increased our quarterly dividend by 10 percent starting with the fourth quarter dividend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This marked the 14th consecutive year that the dividend rate has been increased by a double-digit percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through these accomplishments, Lockheed Martin delivered strong one-year and three-year total stockholder returns (TSR).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On a relative basis, Lockheed Martins three-year TSR significantly outperformed NASDAQ, the Dow Jones Industrial, S&P 500, S&P Industrials, and S&P Aerospace & Defense (S&P Aerospace) indices for the period ended December 31, 2016.

sentences.text: Compensation Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs covering our NEOs are designed to attract and retain critical executive talent, to motivate behaviors that align with stockholders interests and to pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of our NEOs pay is variable and contingent on performance, and two-thirds, on average, is in the form of long-term incentives (LTI).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure pay is competitive with market practices, we conduct benchmarking analyses each year when establishing base salary, annual incentive target opportunities and LTI target opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each element of compensation is evaluated against the 50th percentile, which we refer to as market rate, of a comparator group of companies, as shown on page 37.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For executives new to their role, we target pay below the market rate (50th percentile) and then increase pay closer to 100% of the market rate over a time period based on a variety of factors, including individual performance, experience, time in position and critical skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although target incentive opportunities are set by reference to the market rate, incentive plan terms provide for actual payouts to be based upon actual performance that can result in payouts above or below target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the Corporations performance, the 2016 annual incentive paid out at 179% of target and the 2014-2016 LTIP paid out at 135.2% of target for all NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide retirement programs and perquisites that are competitive in our industry and security that is appropriate for the business in which we operate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Determine Market Rate Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a starting point, for each of the principal elements of executive compensation we define the market rate as the size-adjusted 50th percentile of our comparator group of companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Size-adjusted market rates are calculated for us by Aon Hewitt using regression analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This statistical technique accounts for revenue size differences within the peer group and results in a market rate for all compensation elements consistent with our revenue relationship to our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also may adjust the market rate to reflect differences in an executives job scope relative to the industry or the comparator group of companies, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because market data can increase or decrease year-over-year, the Compensation Committee considers the current market data in combination with other internal factors when setting annual target pay levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our incentive plans are designed so that actual performance in excess of established performance targets results in payouts above target and actual performance below established performance targets results in payouts below target or no payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Select the Comparator Group for Market Rate and Performance Purposes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Companies Selected for Market Rate Determination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We regularly review our comparator group to maintain relevancy and to ensure the availability of data, while seeking to avoid significant annual changes in the group to ensure a level of consistency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To establish the market rate for each of the principal elements of compensation, we select a group of publicly-traded companies (our comparator group) to identify market rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the number of comparable companies with our revenue level is not extensive, we include companies in our comparator group based on a number of factors, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: similarity in size (a high correlative factor in determining pay), generally between one-half and two times our annual revenue;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: participation in the Aon Hewitt executive compensation survey (our primary source for data in making market comparisons); this enables us to obtain reliable data for market comparisons that otherwise may not be publicly available;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: industrial companies and, to the extent possible, companies that compete in the aerospace and defense industry; this enables comparison with companies that face similar overall labor costs, economic factors and market fluctuations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: companies that are included in the executive talent pool we consider when recruiting outside talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive conditions and a limited number of comparably sized aerospace and defense companies require us to recruit outside the core aerospace and defense companies for a broad range of disciplines (e.g., finance, human resources, legal, supply chain management) to obtain individuals with a broad range of skills that are transferable across industries; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: companies with comparable executive officer positions or management structures, which enables more appropriate compensation comparisons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not consider market capitalization in selecting our comparator group because market capitalization can change quickly as industries and companies go in and out of favor as investments and as companies restructure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market capitalization may be more reflective of expectations about a particular companys growth potential rather than its actual financial performance or the complexity of its operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The data presented to and considered by the Compensation Committee regarding the level of compensation at the Corporations comparator group of peer companies was developed from the proprietary results of the Aon Hewitt executive compensation survey, subject to review by Meridian.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the 2016 comparator group companies participated in the Aon Hewitt survey.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, we used the following companies as our comparator group for purposes of establishing market rate compensation for each of the principal elements of our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The comparator group did not change from 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 revenue represented the 59th percentile of our comparator group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As was disclosed in our 2016 Proxy Statement, a new annual incentive design was implemented in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We sought investor input as part of our ongoing investor outreach program and confirmed support of the new design during 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, our institutional stockholders viewed the simplified plan design, in tandem with the enhanced focus on financial criteria, positively.

sentences.text: The new design is intended to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: enhance alignment with stockholder interests by focusing on performance at the Enterprise level
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: utilize financial performance as the core element;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: support a more collaborative team approach among senior leadership ranks, including our NEOs; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: simplify the design for plan participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the 2016 annual incentive plan for our CEO, other NEOs and all other officers elected by the Board, was based 70% on financial goals and 30% on strategic and operational goals measured at the Enterprise level, as illustrated in the graphic below.
